name: Shore Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very frequent traveller for business and leisure. This was a combined trip - business for me, and leisure for my (lucky!) boyfriend. Beds were really comfortable, and we had a great view of the beach from our balcony. Rooms are more European sized; fine for a couple, but no space for a roll-away (for example).
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.text: With the balcony door closed, the traffic noise was faintly audible, but not disturbing. With the doors open, it can be noisy (but no way the hotel could mitigate). Thankfully the Santa Monica bus system uses "green" engines, so you don't get exhaust fumes. The empty fridge was a bonus for us - went to the nearby Whole Foods (on Lincoln, just south of the hotel) and got breakfast items. As we are not fans of room service/mini-bars, the absence of both was not an issue. Loads of restaurants in the immediate vicinity.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel team was all very pleasant, and the reception team very helpful. Used the self-parking under the hotel. Did not see need for valet, but suppose some people expect it. Large shower was lovely design-wise, but the window-wall curtain had to be kept down to preserve modesty for anyone at the toilet. Softest, fluffiest bathrobes EVER... but they do produce lint like mad so beware of brushing the robes up against your black trousers.
reviews.title: first time in santa monica

reviews.text: Only suggestion would be that since it is a "green" hotel, and re-using towels is encouraged, that there should be towel hooks/rods so towels can be hung to dry. Ended up using door handles on the bathroom and closet in desperation.
reviews.title: Now for an unbiased and genuine review!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love Santa Monica and saw this hotel before it was open. Upon investigation, we love that it is a LEED hotel as well. The rooms were pricey and the rooms were a bit smaller than other hotels, but the bathroom and the view were uncompromising. The staff were all friendly and accomodating, the pool and the workout room just lovely. The grand opening rate was okay and when booked directly with the hotel, they also threw in some comps. The pier was super close and therefore so was the beach. The mall and promenade also a stone's throw away. Awesome location!
reviews.title: Excellent time at the Shore Hotel

reviews.text: Our family of five, including three adult boys (16, 20,& 22) rented two rooms at the Shore Hotel in Jan. 2012. Our rooms had a small balcony with a "partially obstructed", but beautiful view of the Sant Monica Beach and Pacific Ocean. These rooms overlooked the pool and were on the south side of the buliding on the 3rd floor. At this time of year there is no sun on these balconies. If you are a sunworshipper or enjoy watching the sun rise and set, we would recommend getting a south facing room (the ones overlooking the pool) on the 3rd or 4th floors or a "Premier Ocean Front" room. There are many different types of rooms with varying views, prices and bed configurations. It would be prudent to clarify these details at the time of booking to avoid confusion. One other note, although the rooms are well soundproofed, the premier ocean front rooms at the front of the hotel, may be a bit noisier than the ones set further back, especially when sitting out on the balcony, because of the traffic. All in all the rooms were very clean, the beds and linens were fresh and comfortable and the maid service was efficient and friendly. We loved the rain shower and did not have any problems with water temperature or pressure. There was an empty fridge in our rooms which was extremely convenient and we enjoyed having free wifi in our room. Our sons enjoyed the pool and hot tub and took advantage of the fitness facility in the hotel. The location of this hotel is fantastic as it is a short walk to the pier,all of the best restaurants, sites, beaches, bike paths, rentals and jogging trails. The fact that there was no restaurant in the hotel was not a big deal as it forced us to explore the area and experience different restaurants. Although this hotel is one of the pricier hotels in the area, it was immaculately clean, safe and well situated. Perhaps the best part of this hotel was the welcoming staff. Stevie, Cash, Kimberley and our booking assistant Lynette, were extremley friendly, accomodating and patient with all of our queries and questions. They really made us feel at home. The valet staff and doormen James and Randell always greeted us with a smile. All in all we had a wonderful time at this hotel, the weather was fantastic and we didnt want to leave. We can't wait to return. Thank you for memorable and happy experience.
reviews.title: "Wonderful Family Experience!"

reviews.text: We booked a night in the Ocean View room for our last night in the USA so were expecting and hoping for a great room. We were disappointed by the following things:
reviews.title: All Style, not substance - not worth the price tag

reviews.text: - WiFi did not work majority of time and staff were unable to help fix this problem
reviews.title: Great Service with more to come...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Poor cell reception
reviews.title: mixed experience

reviews.text: - Beds did not have plush cushioning & pillows were flat
reviews.title: Great location, lots of glass, solid property

reviews.text: Love the location. The staff member who checked me in seemed to be having a bad day and looked and acted really cranky. However the room was pretty nice and clean. Central to everything. Parking was easy. We will be back. Hopefully the staff will be having a better day.
reviews.title: Great hotel, staff needs to be friendlier

reviews.text: The Shore was the last of the 5 hotels we stayed on during our trip to the US over New Year's 2012 & it was the only one I hadn't pre-booked before we left Singapore. Reason was that LA was our first & last stop & I wanted to see during our first leg what other hotels we could consider for our final leg & The Shore was a perfect choice!
reviews.title: New & sleek, perfect location

reviews.text: We visited Santa Monica on a city tour during our first stop in LA & my teenagers loved Santa Monica right away so we looked around for a hotel to consider. The Shore was a natural choice. It's new, directly opposite the Pier, & just behind it is Third Street Promenade.
reviews.title: thanksgiving weekend

reviews.text: We drove down from San Francisco & arrived on a Sat afternoon. Check in was super efficient as was parking & unloading the bags with the bellman meeting us in the carpark to take our bags.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Perfect Location!

reviews.text: Our room faced the Pier as requested & is such a pretty sight especially at night when the ferris wheel is all lit up. I would try & specially request for the rooms closer to the pool though as I didn't realize the hotel also has the side wing & while our room & balcony faced the Pier, immediately in front of us was the carpark of the restaurant next door.
reviews.title: Great Christmas Experience!!!
Love Santa Monica, Love The Shore Hotel
reviews.text: We have visited Santa Monica several times but this was our first stay at The Shore and it will not be our last. Loved the zen feel and look of the hotel, the cool set up of the room and of course the great location,near the beach, shops and restaurants.
Service was warm, friendly and helpful - enjoyed a great experience.
reviews.title: New oasis in Santa Monica

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the beach community Santa Monica and often recommend staying here when visiting L.A. (Los Angeles). Even if you plan on crisscrossing the city to see all the more or less worthwhile attractions (Hollywood, Universal Studios, Downtown, etc), Santa Monica is still the ideal place to begin and end a day's long journeys in traffic.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Santa Monica has the some of L.A.'s cleanest air, friendly locals and there are plenty of nice cafés, bars and restaurants and really, really good shopping here. And of course, this is where you'll enjoy the gorgeous Santa Monica Beach – literally spearheaded by the classic amusement park on Santa Monica Pier.
reviews.title: Truly Modern Hotel - Friendly Staff - Great Location - Inexpensive Parking

reviews.text: Up until recently, Santa Monica only had a few reasonably good hotels. Most of them large and corporate (boring), some of them complete dives that should be avoided (dirty, run down and expensive).
reviews.title: not good for production travel

description: The essence of legendary 5 star customer service and breath taking ocean views Shore Hotel celebrated our soft opening in early October of 2011 and are proud to be Santa Monica's first and only upscale boutique Gold LEED certified property. Shore Hotel is pleased to announce the recent opening of our poolside bar as well as the much anticipated opening of our restaurant, Blue Plate Taco on September 23rd, 2012. Shore Hotel is located on Ocean Avenue in Santa Monica, just steps from the Santa Monica Pier, 3rd Street Promenade, and the city’s popular beaches and shopping districts. Shore Hotel is the newest addition to the coastline—a Gold LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certified property that offers eco-friendly accommodations with stunning views of the Pacific Ocean. Gensler Architecture conceived the Shore Hotel’s California modern design, which features 164 stylishly appointed rooms dressed in beach shades of teal and orange and outfitted with custom-made Teak wood furniture.
